title: CORRECTED-Parsley Energy will not add rigs if oil prices rise further -CEO
text:
March 27, 2018 / 7:27 PM / Updated 4 minutes ago Parsley Energy will not add rigs if oil prices rise further: CEO Reuters Staff 1 Min Read 
(In this March 27 story corrects planned number of frack crews in second paragraph) A drilling rig is seen at a well site owned by Parsley Energy Inc near Midland, Texas, U.S., May 3, 2017. Picture taken May 3, 2017. REUTERS/Ernest Scheyder 
NEW ORLEANS (Reuters) - Parsley Energy Inc ( PE.N ) has no plans to add more drilling rigs if oil prices CLc1 rise further, part of a plan to focus on boosting returns, the U.S. shale oil producer’s chief executive said on Tuesday. 
The company plans to run 16 drilling rigs and five fracking crews this year in the Permian Basin, the largest U.S. oilfield, CEO Bryan Sheffield said at the Scotia Howard Weil energy conference in New Orleans. 
“We need to execute. We need to get back to firing on all cylinders,” Sheffield said. 
The company had been considered one of the more-aggressive shale producers in recent years, and its conservative turn on rig count comes at a time when Wall Street had been pressuring the shale industry to focus more on shareholder returns. Reporting by Ernest Scheyder
